summary: Business leader with 20 years of experience in product management, strategy, finance, marketing, and operations, and a proven track record of tackling complex problems and reinvigorating low-performing enterprises. Excel at collaborating with and leading diverse and cross-functional stakeholders to create and implement elegant solutions. Effective at combining a user-centric approach with analytical rigor to identify customer needs and develop products and processes that solves those needs. Talent for building and managing high-performing teams.

Justin Purnell is Head of Product for Hotels at Home, Inc. Prior to this role, Justin served as in Strategy and Business Development for NBCUniversal Digital Enterprises after launching Seeso, NBCU’s Subscription Video on Demand service as Director of Content Strategy and Operations. Justin also directed Amy Poehler’s web series “Smart Girls at the Party,” a web series for ON Networks targeted towards building self-esteem in early adolescent girls. Justin worked at Goldman Sachs for seven years, where he published over 400 pieces of written research as a high yield credit analyst in the Energy and Gaming, Lodging, and Leisure industries.

Justin earned an MBA at the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth and is Co-President of the Tuck Club of New York. President of the Class of 2000, he graduated from Princeton University with an A.B. in Economics and certificates in Finance and Political Philosophy. Justin has been Secretary of St. Albans’ Great(est?) Class of 1996 since their graduation, is an inaugural Headmaster’s Counselor, and is a co-lead of the school’s Black Alumni Alliance.

**Justin Purnell is a product strategist and entrepreneur** dedicated to finding clever solutions to complex business challenges, currently focused on Ledge Partners. His approach is built on a foundation of analytical rigor established during seven years at **Goldman Sachs**, where he served as a high yield credit analyst and published over 400 research reports. This deep background informs his strategic prudence, guiding him to trust thorough analysis over market consensus, a principle validated early in his career.

**A Builder Focused on Efficiency:** In his product leadership roles, Justin focuses on operational simplicity and technical enablement. As Head of Product at **Hotels at Home** , he guided a global team through the challenging modernization of technology across over 70 global e-commerce sites. He actively uses technology to solve immediate problems, demonstrated by utilizing self-taught Swift knowledge to design a middleware prototype that reduced vendor onboarding time from four months to two weeks, and pioneering **AI solutions** to automate product data generation.

**Collaborative Change Agent:** Justin excels in high-stakes situations that require mediating conflict and forging consensus. When leading the Content Commerce launch, he stepped in as a 'referee', successfully resolving disputes between internal and external teams by leading workshops that forced stakeholders to **prioritize and get everyone 'rowing together'**. Similarly, he managed conflict with a data gatekeeper by building collaborative relationships and training the team to spread the burden of analysis, resulting in productive, 'good terms' outcomes.

**Committed to Community and Creative Expression:** Beyond the corporate world, Justin is devoted to service and the arts. He is deeply engaged as **President of the Princeton University Class of 2000**, leading its governance and successful fundraising efforts, including overseeing a $6 million capital campaign and leading a record-breaking 2,000-person reunion. Drawing on his background performing and producing at the **Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre**, he also directed Amy Poehler's web series, *Smart Girls at the Party*.

**Strategic Architect & Technical Owner:** Proven ability to drive deep technical change and efficiency, including leading the complete re-platforming of 70+ global e-commerce sites. Demonstrated hands-on technical proficiency by designing a middleware prototype in Swift that drastically cut vendor onboarding time from four months to two weeks and pioneering **AI/LLM integration** to automate 14,000 SKUs of product data in two hours for under $5.

**High-Impact Growth Driver:** Expertise in monetization and retention developed across finance (Goldman Sachs) and digital media (NBCUniversal). Generated significant commercial outcomes by developing a strategic model that identified **$120 million in potential new revenue** (Google Glass) and leading retention initiatives that increased customer **Lifetime Value by 40%** (Seeso).

**Executive Consensus & Crisis Leader:** Skilled at mobilizing diverse and skeptical cross-functional teams in high-stakes environments. Successfully intervened to resolve a major dispute between NBCU and a 3rd party vendor by securing trust and buy-in through collaboration and converting a key data gatekeeper/saboteur into an ally through direct confrontation and subsequent collaboration.

**Sustained Executive Commitment:** Demonstrated sustained executive capacity and commitment by successfully leading the Princeton University Class of 2000 (1,143 alumni), managing a major non-profit P&L (responsible for a **$6.5 million annual giving campaign**), and managing the logistics for a record-breaking 2,000-person reunion, proving high-level leadership and project execution capacity outside of traditional corporate roles.

**Executive Leader and Financial Strategist:** Accomplished business leader with over 20 years of multifaceted experience spanning finance, strategy, product management, and operations. Began corporate career at Goldman Sachs, serving seven years as a high yield credit analyst and risk manager, publishing over 400 research reports and advising institutional investors and C-level executives. Grounded execution in rigorous strategic and financial analysis.

**Digital Transformation and Growth Generation:** Expertise in scaling digital platforms, monetization, and user retention in high-growth media and e-commerce environments. Led the complete re-platforming of technology supporting **over 70 global e-commerce sites** for major hospitality brands. At NBCUniversal’s Seeso, directed strategy and operations, leading user retention initiatives that lifted customer **Lifetime Value by 40%**.

**Hands-On Innovation and Change Management:** Proven ability to resolve critical operational bottlenecks and launch stalled projects. Successfully launched NBCU's Content Commerce e-commerce marketplace after assuming the lead role for the **$10mm project**. Has demonstrated technical ownership by pioneering the use of **AI/LLM integration** to automate product data for 14,000 SKUs. Utilizes consensus-building workshops to referee disputes and get cross-functional teams **'rowing together'**.

**Executive Governance and Community Leadership:** Holds high-level, external leadership roles, with long-term commitment and organizational acumen. As President of the Princeton University Class of 2000, manages 1,143 alumni and is responsible for the annual giving campaign, leading all classes in **dollars raised ($6.5mm) and participation (62.9%)**. This volunteer work also includes leading a **$6 million capital campaign** and managing complex, record-breaking 2,000-person events.

**Executive Leader and Financial Strategist:** Accomplished business leader with over 20 years of multifaceted experience spanning product management, strategy, finance, and operations. Began corporate career at Goldman Sachs, publishing over 400 research reports and advising C-level executives. Favors execution grounded in **rigorous analytical and financial modeling skills**.

**Digital Transformation and Growth Generation:** Expertise in scaling digital platforms, monetization, and user retention in high-growth media and e-commerce environments. Led the complete re-platforming of technology supporting **over 70 global e-commerce sites**. Directed product retention strategy for NBCUniversal’s Seeso streaming service, lifting customer **Lifetime Value by 40%**.

**Creative and High-Impact Communication Leader:** Recognized for combining corporate rigor with creative leadership, possessing strong capabilities in team mobilization and high-stakes communication. Directed the first season of Amy Poehler’s Webby-awarded web series *'Smart Girls at the Party'* and served as a **founding producer for UCBcomedy.com**. This unique background proves a mastery of presenting, negotiation, and generating consensus across cross-functional teams.

**Sustained Executive Governance and Commitment:** Demonstrated sustained capacity for executive leadership and large-scale project management through extensive non-profit commitments. As President of the Princeton University Class of 2000 (1,143 alumni), he manages a large P&L, leading all classes in **dollars raised ($6.5mm) and participation (62.9%)**, countering concerns about career focus or retention risk.

**Entrepreneurial Strategist & Builder:** Justin Purnell is the Founder of **Ledge Partners**, dedicated to acquiring and leading profitable businesses. His foundation is built on seven years at **Goldman Sachs** as a high yield credit analyst, where he published over **400 research reports** and advised C-level executives.

**Product Innovation and Scale:** He led the complete **re-platforming of technology supporting over 70 e-commerce sites** globally as Head of Product at **Hotels at Home**. He actively builds technical solutions, including pioneering **AI-powered software** to automate product data generation and designing a Swift middleware prototype that cut vendor onboarding time from **four months to two weeks**.

**Driving Financial and Organizational Results:** At **NBCUniversal's Seeso**, he directed product operations and retention initiatives that resulted in a **40% increase in customer Lifetime Value**. He is adept at mobilizing cross-functional teams, having successfully stepped in to **referee a dispute** between NBC and a third-party vendor to foster consensus and launch the Content Commerce platform.

**Creative and Governance Leadership:** Justin combines corporate rigor with creative experience, having directed the Webby-awarded web series **Smart Girls at the Party** and serving as a founding producer for **UCBcomedy.com**. He maintains significant governance roles, including serving as **President of the Princeton University Class of 2000** (1,143 alumni) and managing its annual giving campaigns.
I bring a combination of finance, product, and hands-on engineering execution:

**Finance and strategy**: 7 years at Goldman Sachs advising institutional investors and company leadership; marketed primary and secondary offerings totaling $6B+ and published 400+ research reports across Energy and Gaming, Lodging & Leisure. In 2006, I cautioned on leverage/housing risks ahead of the crisis.

**Product and operations**: As Head of Product at Hotels at Home, led the full re-platform of technology supporting 70+ global e-commerce sites across 40+ hospitality brands and managed a 14-person global team. At NBCUniversal’s Seeso, led retention initiatives that increased Customer Lifetime Value by 40%.

**Technical innovation**: Built an LLM-driven pipeline to harmonize product data for 14,000 SKUs in four languages (~2 hours, under $5), and prototyped Swift middleware that cut vendor onboarding from four months to two weeks. Led delivery of the Seeso Apple TV app with Big Nerd Ranch; built an internal Swift app in one month, enabling a distribution shift that increased the subscriber base by 33%.
I excel at aligning cross-functional teams, simplifying complex systems, and delivering measurable results.

stories.title: Replatforming Hotels at Home
stories.situation: Had to manage the replatforming of primary systems at Hotels at Home, which had outdated and inefficient technology.
stories.task: Needed to modernize the technology while overcoming past failures and skepticism from the team.
stories.action: Focused on generating buy-in by addressing stakeholders' needs and concerns and emphasizing 'show' rather than 'tell.'
stories.result: Created momentum for the major project, despite progress being slower than desired.
stories.summary: Generated buy-in for replatforming by addressing concerns and demonstrating solutions, creating project momentum.

stories.title: HAH GPT Product Data
stories.situation: We were migrating 14,000 SKUs across 26 properties from Magento 1 to Magento 2 with incomplete product data, causing major issues.
stories.task: Needed to generate essential product data (Google Product Code, Harmonized System Code, short product summary) for integration with Avlara.
stories.action: Integrated a Large Language Model (ChatGPT) via API to automate the generation of product data from long descriptions and specifications.
stories.result: Successfully generated necessary product data in roughly 2 hours for under $5, eliminating months of manual work.
stories.summary: Automated product data generation using a Large Language Model, saving months of manual work.

highlights: Assumed Lead role for stalled $10mm e-commerce marketplace and brought it to launch in 8 months
Introduced agile software development process, focused team goals, managed senior internal stakeholders
Led communication bewteen internal team and third-party vendors to influence decision-making
Renegotiated primary platform relationship, and project managed third-party deliverables
Designed and product managed development of two applications, reducing onboarding from four months to two weeks

stories.title: Content Commerce Middleware
stories.situation: NBCU was developing a golf industry marketplace but faced significant delays in vendor onboarding due to cumbersome platform requirements.
stories.task: The goal was to reduce vendor onboarding time and costs to enable an on-time project launch.
stories.action: I led workshops to identify pain points, proposed a middleware solution leveraging Shopify's API, designed and developed a working prototype in Swift, and coordinated with in-house developers for cloud deployment.
stories.result: Vendor onboarding time was reduced from four months to two weeks, allowing the platform to launch on time with 29 integrated brands and significant media coverage.
stories.summary: Built a middleware solution that drastically reduced onboarding time, enabling a successful project launch.

stories.title: Shop with Golf
stories.summary: Collaboratively launched a complex Content Commerce platform by prioritizing essentials over wishlist items, ensuring customer-facing smoothness.
stories.situation: Content Commerce launch faced numerous tech challenges; necessary features were prioritized during workshops.
stories.task: Needed to solve problems and prioritize essential features over wishlist items to ensure a smooth launch.
stories.action: Held workshops, prioritized automation and batch features, and reassured team with an analogy during a meeting.
stories.result: Successfully launched the platform with a smooth customer-facing experience.

positions.position: Interim Vice President, Strategy & Business Development
highlights: Directed business development initiatives focused on strategy for NBCU Digital
Presented audio industry analysis to CFO, CEO, leading to company-wide partnership
Developed NBCU OKRs and KPIs for new investments, identifying ten potential new business lines
Managed all project deliverables and advised senior leadership
Appointed to lead; delivered a 40% increase in customer Lifetime Value via a RICE-prioritized program spanning product, editorial, and marketing
Led delivery of the AppleTV app with Big Nerd Ranch; built an internal Swift app in one month, enabling a distribution shift that increased the subscriber base by 33%
Built taxonomy/metadata for UX and analytics; launched multiiple third-party distribution partnerships (including Amazon Channels
Developed clustering analysis to guide content and savings; hired and managed a 4-person content operations team
Drove development of analytics platform as a standalone business now utilized by NBCU and third parties

stories.title: Accedo Profiles
stories.summary: Overcame launch issue at Seeso by brute-forcing and later developed an Excel tool to simplify future launches.
stories.situation: Vendor informed us that preproduction couldn't be cloned on Seeso's launch night.
stories.task: Needed to manually copy preproduction data to ensure the launch proceeded as scheduled.
stories.action: Stayed overnight to manually copy data and later developed an Excel tool to automate the process.
stories.result: Successfully launched Seeso and created a tool to prevent future similar issues.

stories.title: Seeso Platform Difficulties
stories.summary: Seeso's CMS inefficiencies led to manual applications and platform inconsistencies; a dynamic API would have been better.
stories.situation: Seeso's CMS partner wasn't set up for efficient cross-platform support, leading to manual application setup and inconsistencies.
stories.task: Needed to deploy Seeso on every platform while managing inefficiencies and discrepancies across different devices.
stories.action: Manually set up applications for each platform despite them not respecting native conventions, leading to platform-specific issues.
stories.result: Encountered breaking changes and display inconsistencies; concluded that a dynamic API would have been more effective.

stories.title: Seeso AppleTV App
stories.summary: Swift knowledge enabled negotiation and collaboration with Big Nerd Ranch, leading to a timely AppleTV app launch.
stories.situation: Third party failed to deliver AppleTV app, projecting a one-year delay.
stories.task: Ensure timely delivery of the AppleTV app for the Holiday season.
stories.action: Contacted Big Nerd Ranch, negotiated rates, and worked as Product Manager to oversee project completion.
stories.result: Successfully launched AppleTV app in time for the Holiday season.

stories.title: Seeso Marketing Disagreement
stories.situation: I disagreed with Seeso's marketing efforts, as they were not aligning with our target demographic, the 'Comedy Nerd.'
stories.task: We needed to help the marketing group understand our target demographic better to improve their efforts.
stories.action: We had a talk with the marketing team and presented data from a KPMG study, and recommended they attend comedy shows.
stories.result: The marketing team gained a better understanding of the demographic, softened their tone, and rethought their approach, especially on social media.
stories.summary: Presented data and exposure to comedy shows improved marketing's alignment with the target demographic.

stories.title: Churn Reduction at Seeso
stories.situation: At the end of our first year at Seeso, our monthly churn rate was 22%, significantly higher than the industry benchmark of 10%. I was appointed 'Churn Czar' to address this issue.
stories.task: My goal was to reduce monthly churn by 2% each quarter, aiming for a 14% churn rate by the end of the year.
stories.action: I identified five key areas to target and adopted a 'whole of service' approach. We generated 23 ideas and prioritized them using the RICE framework. Collaborated with different groups to set measurable goals and prioritized efforts by anticipated ROI.
stories.result: Implemented several low-effort items quickly, reducing churn by 6% in the first quarter, translating to a 40% increase in overall customer lifetime value.
stories.summary: Reduced Seeso's churn, creating a 40% increase in customer lifetime value by prioritizing and implementing service improvements.

highlights: Built strategies for MSNBC/News Group’s YouTube and younger audiences; established KPIs and OKRs

stories.title: Comcast.com Dashboards with Andy
stories.summary: Resolved conflict with data gatekeeper, collaborated on data analysis, and improved team numeracy, leaving on good terms.
stories.situation: Andy, the data gatekeeper, saw my project as a threat and attempted to sabotage it.
stories.task: I needed to address the conflict with Andy and ensure accurate data analysis for the project.
stories.action: I called out Andy's bad data, explained my collaborative intentions, and trained the team on my models and dashboards.
stories.result: We resolved the conflict, shared the data burden, and left on good terms.

highlights: Ran a pilot program that lifted returning uniques by 300%, hiring comedians to host chat rooms in a second-screen app; made permanent by the product team.
Developed a $120mm model, labor plan, and GTM strategy via non-linear optimization for 17 potential Google Glass applications
Produced regression analysis of promotion versus activity, working with Insights and Media Strategy team

stories.title: Zeebox Pilot
stories.summary: Revitalized Zeebox app by hiring comedians to host chat rooms, lifting returning uniques by 300% and creating lasting engagement.
stories.situation: NBCU's second screen app, Zeebox, released a new feature for individual chat rooms late in the TV season, with low activity.
stories.task: Increase activity and engagement in the chat rooms within the Zeebox app.
stories.action: Hired comedians to host chat rooms during broadcasts of American Idol, Pretty Little Liars, and Marvel's Agents of Shield, and stretched the pilot budget for 10 weeks.
stories.result: Significantly increased engagement for two shows, lifting returning uniques by 300%, and made comedian-hosted chat rooms a permanent app feature.

highlights: Supported strategy, analytics, and negotiations; analyzed consumption behavior and navigation to inform product strategy in comedy and news

stories.title: Smart Girls
stories.summary: Directed Amy Poehler's show, overcame editing issues by hiring editors, and learned the importance of understanding team roles.
stories.situation: Amy Poehler asked me to direct 'Smart Girls at the Party,' a major project with a tight timeline and significant budget.
stories.task: Get all eight episodes edited before SNL ended its break, despite disorganized footage and the absence of our editor.
stories.action: Borrowed an edit bay and hired three editors at personal expense to complete the project on time.
stories.result: Met the deadline, learned the importance of understanding team roles for successful project management.

stories.title: Magic Bus Story Tour Organization
stories.situation: Chris had a popular theater show where he narrated personal stories, capturing a dedicated audience.
stories.task: The goal was to create an interactive bus tour featuring the actual locations of Chris' stories.
stories.action: We chartered a bus, selected appropriate stories, mapped a feasible route through Northern New Jersey, coordinated with homeowners, and managed food logistics.
stories.result: The tour was a success, featured in Time Out New York, revitalizing Chris' career and leading to a follow-up Halloween event.
stories.summary: Organized an engaging tour that revitalized a storyteller's career.

highlights: Published over 200 individual research reports across four industries
Met regularly with C-level management of covered companies
Presented daily to sales force and traders on market moving developments
Built and developed models on 20 companies in Gaming, Lodging, and Leisure industries

Successfully advised corporate leadership and marketed primary and secondary offerings in excess of $6 billion

stories.title: Station Casinos MBO
stories.summary: Stood by analysis of Station Casinos MBO, advising investors to sell, which proved correct during the financial crisis.
stories.situation: Station Casinos announced a management buyout in late 2006 with $2.7B in debt financing, taking leverage from 5.6x to 9.0x in a vulnerable market.
stories.task: Analyzed the buyout deal and advise investors on whether to buy or sell shares. Had to stand by while every other analyst in the market said it was fine.
stories.action: Presented a cautious analysis based on housing market risks and advised investors to sell, despite criticism from a predecessor and friend.
stories.result: Station Casinos went bankrupt during the financial crisis, validating my analysis and teaching me to trust in thorough analysis over charismatic reassurances.

stories.title: GS Tesoro Deal
stories.summary: Guided major deal during boss's absence, ensuring its completion and earning a promotion for effective analysis and client engagement.
stories.situation: My boss suddenly left to negotiate a better offer during a major deal, leaving the team without guidance.
stories.task: Provide immediate guidance and support for the salesforce to keep the major deal on track.
stories.action: Presented distilled analysis at all hands meeting, and spent days engaging with clients to defend the deal.
stories.result: Successfully completed the deal, boss returned with matched offer, and I was promoted for my efforts.
